alert.note: Alert for Terry (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 30 at 7:16PM CDT until June 30 at 7:45PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Texas, including the following county, Terry. * WHEN...Until 830 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 716 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated continuing moderate rain due to slow-moving thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen along US-385 northwest of Brownfield. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible over the area. This additional rain will result in the continuation of minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tokio and Meadow.
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
